He appears in five episodes between 17 December 2009 and 1 January 2010, and again in April 2010.<ref name="Kilkelly">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a215973/enders-actress-wants-qadim-comeback.html|title='Enders actress wants Qadim comeback|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=22 April 2010|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=3 May 2010}}</ref> He appears again from 6 September 2011,<ref>{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 06/09/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b0146f01 |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Nic Phillips; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: [[Daran Little]] |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=6 September 2011}}</ref> when Amira returns to Walford.<ref>{{cite journal|date=23-29 July 2011|title=Amira's back..with Syed's baby|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|issue=29|page=11|accessdate=19 July 2011}}</ref>
Qadim is introduced when Amira visits him in prison. They hug and he says he wants to make up for lost time. She tells him she and her boyfriend [[Syed Masood]] ([[Marc Elliott]]) are back together and are now engaged. Qadim is instantly furious and refuses to give them his blessing. Amira later takes money for the wedding from his safety deposit box without him knowing, using a key she has hidden inside a photo album.
On the day of Amira and Syed's [[Mehndi celebration]], Amira receives a call saying Qadim's lawyer has found a loophole in the law meaning that Qadim can be released. After his release, he interrupts the Mehndi. The next day, Syed's mother [[Zainab Masood|Zainab]] ([[Nina Wadia]]) is angry at his actions and Amira is forced to reveal that Qadim has not given his blessing and that she stole the money. Qadim arrives at the Masoods' home and says that Syed does not love Amira and will break her heart. Syed tells him they took his money but Amira interrupts and says it was her idea. Qadim orders her to pack her bags but she defies him and Syed says they will pay back the money. Qadim says angrily says he expects the money the next day in cash and leaves. He returns on the day of the wedding and talks to Amira. When he realises how much Masood has done for her, he gives his blessing and agrees to pay for the wedding.
Qadim returns as a guest at Syed and Amira's house warming party on 23 April,<ref>{{cite press release|publisher= BBC Press Office|date= 1 April 2010|url= http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/proginfo/tv/2010/wk16/fri.shtml#fri_eastenders|title= Network TV BBC Week 16: Friday 23 April 2010|accessdate= 1 April 2010}}</ref> where Syed reveals that he is gay and has been seeing [[Christian Clarke]] ([[John Partridge (performer)|John Partridge]]). Qadim attacks Syed, saying he warned Amira not to marry him. After Amira packs her bags, Qadim takes her home with him. He returns days later with two associates, looking for Syed. Masood tells them he has been unable to contact him. They then break into Christian's flat and wait for him. When he arrives, Qadim demands to know where Syed is and refuses to believe him when he says he does not know. They then beat him up and leave.
In 2011, Syed and Christian decide to find Amira so Syed can get a divorce. They feel the only way to do so is to find Qadim first, but Zainab forbids it as he wanted to kill them both. Zainab's ex-husband and father of her daughter-in-law, [[Yusef Khan]] ([[Ace Bhatti]]), tells Zainab it may be a good idea to find Amira anyway. He then visits Qadim and says that if Syed can believe he is getting his way, then Yusef will be able to avenge Qadim's humiliation. It is revealed that Qadim has been keeping Amira prisoner in her own home. Amira secretly meets up with Syed, and introduces hers and Syed's daughter, [[Yasmin Masood|Yasmin]] to the Masood family. When Yusef phones Qadim and tells him that Amira is at the Masood's house, he storms round there and demands that Amira and Yasmin return with him. Amira refuses, and Qadim leaves stating that Amira is no longer his daughter. The next day he sends round all of Amira and Yasmin's belongings to the Masood house.
===Development=== On being cast in the show, Tikaram said: "It's great to be joining a programme that represents a Muslim family in a positive light. It's also fantastic to be working with old friends including [[Nitin Ganatra]] ([[Masood Ahmed]]) and Preeya Kalidas."<ref name="qadim">{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a182205/this-life-actor-tikaram-joins-enders.html|title='This Life' actor Tikaram joins 'Enders|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=16 October 2009|accessdate=16 October 2009}}</ref> Qadim is described as an "intelligent and dynamic man" who "oozes charm and sex appeal", and it is said that the death of his wife left him a "bitter, controlling tyrant".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/8310464.stm|title=This Life star joins EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC News Online]]|date=16 October 2009|accessdate=17 October 2009}}</ref> ''[[Inside Soap]]'' described him as 'wicked' and 'violent', and said "Qadim would be a face Syed would rather forget". <ref name="return">{{cite journal|date=23-29 July 2011|title=Amira's back..with Syed's baby|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|issue=29|page=11|accessdate=19 July 2011}}</ref>
Ganatra told entertainment website [[Digital Spy]] that he felt Qadim's attack on Christian was not homophobic, but that of a father venting his anger.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a216845/ganatra-praises-enders-attack-twist.html|title=Ganatra praises 'Enders attack twist|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=28 April 2010|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=4 May 2010}}</ref> Following the episode's broadcast, the BBC received around 40 complaints from viewers who felt the scenes were inappropriate for children and further complaints that the scenes may encourage anti-gay assaults. The BBC said they were careful to ensure their shows were "appropriate for their time slots".<ref>{{cite news|last=Robertson|first=Colin|date=4 May 2010|title=No Ender fury over attack on gay Christian|journal=TV Biz'' section of ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|publisher=[[News Group Newspapers]]|location=London|page=1|accessdate=4 May 2010}}</ref> {{-}}
==Afia Khan==<!-- please do not rename this section a) redirects point to it and b) WP:COMMONNAME --> {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |name= Afia Khan |portrayer= [[Meryl Fernandes]] |introducer= [[Diederick Santer]] (2009) </br> [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] (2010) |years= 2009â |first= 29 December 2009 |last= |alias= Afia Masood (married name) |classification= [[List of EastEnders characters#Present characters|Present; regular]] |home= 1b Albert Square |occupation= Optician's receptionist (until 2011)<br> Delivery driver (since 2011)<br> Waitress (since 2011) |husband=[[Tamwar Masood]] (2011â) |father=[[Yusef Khan]] |aunts=<!-- please do not add Bushra as she is not her real auntie -->[[List of EastEnders characters (2011)#Shameem|Shameem]] |relatives= [[List of EastEnders characters (2011)#Tariq|Tariq]] }} '''Afia Masood''' (nÃ©e '''Khan'''), played by [[Meryl Fernandes]],<ref name="afia profile" /> appeared in five episodes between 29 December 2009 and 5 January 2010, and returned on 18 November 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a286461/billy-discovers-shirleys-secret.html|title= Billy discovers Shirley's secret}}</ref> This is Fernandes' second role in ''EastEnders'', her first being a schoolgirl in 1993.<ref name="spotlight">{{cite web|url=http://www.spotlight.com/interactive/cv/5218-9088-4597|title=MERYL FERNANDES Spotlight Actresses 2010/2011|work=Spotlight|date=2010/2011|accessdate=11 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref>
Afia is a friend of [[#Bushra Abbasi|Bushra Abbasi]]'s ([[Pooja Ghai]]) daughter [[#Zulekha Abbasi|Zulekha Abbasi]] ([[Lisa Shah]]). Afia's mother is abroad so Bushra lets Afia stay with her. She attends [[Syed Masood]] ([[Marc Elliott]]) and [[Amira Shah]]'s ([[Preeya Kalidas]]) [[Mehndi celebration]], with Bushra and Zulekha. Zulekha gives [[Tamwar Masood]] ([[Himesh Patel]]) Afia's mobile number, though he thinks it is Zulekha's, and arranges a date. He is surprised when Afia turns up instead, and she says he is cute in a "[[geek chic]]" way. At Syed and Amira's wedding, Afia gives Tamwar some contact lenses, saying Zulekha might prefer him without his glasses. He confesses to her that he has never kissed a girl "properly", so she proposes if he puts the contacts in, she will give him lessons. They end up kissing more than once. However, Tamwar tells her he is a student at [[Oxford University]] and she is told by Bushra that he is not. Despite this, she was willing to stay with him until he refuses to laugh at the situation, at which point she dumps him. Afia's mother dies off screen.
Several months later in 2010, she contacts Tamwar and they meet up. They spend time kissing at Tamwar's house while his parents, [[Zainab Masood]] ([[Nina Wadia]]) and [[Masood Ahmed]] ([[Nitin Ganatra]]) are out. They insist nothing went on, and Zainab and Masood arrange a dinner to get to know Afia better. Afia lies to them that her father, [[Yusef Khan]] ([[Ace Bhatti]]), is a surgeon, when in actual fact he is a [[General Practitioner|GP]]. Tamwar meets Afia and her father in a restaurant where Tamwar believes Yusef will think he is not good enough for his daughter, but says she is amazing. Yusef accepts Tamwar as his lack of wealth is unimportant to him but he obviously cares about Afia. When Yusef meets Zainab and Masood, it is revealed he is Zainab's ex-husband whose family set her on fire for infidelity. On this discovery, Tamwar tells Afia they cannot see each other again. The next day Afia visits Tamwar and tries to persuade him to reconsider. Tamwar refuses, saying he has to respect the will of his parents. Syed arranges for Afia to see Tamwar again, and they spend time alone together. However, Masood discovers this and again bans Tamwar from seeing her. Tamwar and Afia continue to see each other and Tamwar tries to tell his parents this on their anniversary but does not want to ruin their day so instead, [[Darren Miller]] ([[Charlie G. Hawkins]]) pretends he was meeting Afia to sell her a car. However, at the opening of the Masoods' new restaurant, the Argee Bhajee, Afia turns up having been invited by Tamwar. Tamwar is again forbidden from seeing her, so says he will move out so he no longer has to live by his parents' rules. Eventually, Zainab is told by [[Denise Johnson]] ([[Diane Parish]]) that they will force the couple together by forbidding their relationship, so Zainab and Masood agree to let them see each other in the hope that it will fizzle out naturally.
Afia prepares to tell Yusef that she and Tamwar are still together but before she can, he hands her a round the world ticket. Afia refuses it and tells him that she is still with Tamwar and wants to stay with him. Afia turns up for dinner with Tamwar's family at, but only Zainab turns up. Zainab starts to take a liking to Afia but when Jane persuades Masood to turn up, Afia starts talking about Yusef which upsets Zainab. Back at the house, Masood tells Afia to dump Tamwar as the thought of Yusef is upsetting Zainab. She then leaves, telling Tamwar that her dad had just rung and wanted her home. Afia then accepts the ticket from Yusef. However, when Tamwar finds out, he asks Masood to convince Yusef that he is good enough for Afia. Yusef visits and Tamwar reveals he and Afia have been seeing each other for a few weeks, so Yusef gives his blessing for them to marry. Although they are happy, Masood and Zainab do not want Yusef to become part of their family.
When Zulekha tells Masood that Afia could have any man she wants, he accuses Afia of lying that she is not a virgin. Afia fears that everything will be ruined, so she and Tamwar marry in secret on the night before their mangni (engagement party). Masood later realises his mistake and Zulekha apologises to Afia at the mangni. Tamwar is about to tell his family that they are already married when they are interrupted by Syed's entrance and the roof collapsing. They then decide against telling anyone as Tamwar's parents are facing financial difficulties. Afia and Yusef make the move to Albert Square. However, when Afia and Tamwar learn that Masood kidnapped Yusef and threatened him, this leads to Masood being banned from the couple's mehndi, causing a strain between Tamwar and his father. However, at the mehndi, Tamwar and Afia admit their secret marriage to the family (including Masood who turns up uninvited), and the couple begin living with each other at the Masood family home. Although Yusef moves out, he later moves back after lying to Zainab that it is not safe for her on her own. Afia tells Yusef that he will bring shame on her by being in a relationship with Zainab as it will make Afia and Tamwar [[mahram]] to each other, so Yusef then an [[imam]] and reports to Afia that it would be acceptable for him to marry Zainab, and only [[Allah]] can judge them, so Afia reluctantly accepts the relationship. Afia's relative [[List of EastEnders characters (2011)#Tariq|Tariq]] (Antony Bunsee) arrives and her father says that he will give him the Argee Bargee. Tariq tells this to Afia and she says it doesn't belong to her father, leading to Tariq telling Afia that Yusef started the fire.
===Development=== The ''EastEnders'' website describes Afia as "adventurous and straight to the point, doesn't sugar-coat the truth, and doesn't follow everyone else. [...] She knows what she wants and cunningly knows how to get it".<ref name="afia profile">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/characters/afia-khan.shtml|title=Afia Khan played by Meryl Fernandes|date=February 2011|work=EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=27 February 2011}}</ref> When Tamwar and Afia resume their relationship in 2010, Patel said that Tamwar is grateful for his second chance with Afia.<ref name="Tamwar Afia">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/interviews/a287945/himesh-patel-tamwar-masood-eastenders.html|title=Himesh Patel (Tamwar Masood, 'EastEnders')|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=16 November 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=16 November 2010|location=London}}</ref> He revealed that he was "very happy" when the producers revealed they were bringing Fernandes back saying "We filmed together for about three or four weeks when she first came into the show, which was about this time [in 2009]. [...] I was always asking people if she was going to come back. Then she dropped me a text to say that they'd got in touch with her and were bringing her back, which was fantastic."<ref name="Tamwar Afia"/> {{-}}
